summary: Based on the provided documents, Robert Shea is mentioned in the context of FBI responses to Congressional committee requests, specifically concerning COINTELPRO and an FBI informant within the New Orleans Legal Assistance Corps. The documents, all dated June 2, 1975, relate to inquiries from Congressional committees, including the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities, regarding investigations and related matters. There is no direct mention of Robert Shea's role or significance in the JFK assassination context within these documents. The documents primarily focus on the FBI's handling of information requests and internal matters related to informants and investigations.
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities
significance: Based solely on the provided documents, Robert Shea's significance in the JFK context is not apparent. The documents focus on FBI responses to Congressional inquiries regarding COINTELPRO and informants, with no direct link to the JFK assassination mentioned.
